intro: Pasania vestita, commonly known as the white pasania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pasania vestita is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
